body:
I reproduced this like this with the latest beta

```
$ date -Is | rclone rcat boxcom:test1/file1.txt
$ date -Is | rclone rcat boxcom:test2/file1.txt
$ rclone copy -vv --retries 1 --low-level-retries 1 boxcom:test2 boxcom:test1
2019/09/05 13:03:01 DEBUG : rclone: Version "v1.49.0-024-g5dad88ae-fix-3506-names-beta" starting with parameters ["rclone" "copy" "-vv" "--retries" "1" "--low-level-retries" "1" "boxcom:test2" "boxcom:test1"]
2019/09/05 13:03:01 DEBUG : Using config file from "/home/ncw/.rclone.conf"
2019/09/05 13:03:02 DEBUG : file1.txt: Modification times differ by -8s: 2019-09-05 05:02:38 -0700 -0700, 2019-09-05 05:02:30 -0700 -0700
2019/09/05 13:03:02 INFO  : box root 'test1': Waiting for checks to finish
2019/09/05 13:03:02 DEBUG : file1.txt: SHA-1 = b28a9df4b94db8bc1fb4ad48a3b0137d8d6f3348 (box root 'test2')
2019/09/05 13:03:02 DEBUG : file1.txt: SHA-1 = f261a573e4a89950c5e8d5d22367570274a987d8 (box root 'test1')
2019/09/05 13:03:02 DEBUG : file1.txt: SHA-1 differ
2019/09/05 13:03:02 INFO  : box root 'test1': Waiting for transfers to finish
2019/09/05 13:03:02 ERROR : file1.txt: Failed to copy: Error "item_name_in_use" (409): Item with the same name already exists
2019/09/05 13:03:02 ERROR : Attempt 1/1 failed with 3 errors and: Error "item_name_in_use" (409): Item with the same name already exists
2019/09/05 13:03:02 Failed to copy with 3 errors: last error was: Error "item_name_in_use" (409): Item with the same name already exists
```

I suspect we need to add an integration test for
- Copy over existing
- Move over existing

and fix any backends that have a problem starting with box!
Same problem as well. I just end up rclone copying/moving to a new temp folder

issue.title: box: fix server-side copying a file over existing dst (and other bisync test fixes)

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
#### What is the purpose of this change?

Several fixes for bisync integration tests, most of which were discussed [here](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/pull/7795#issuecomment-2163295857).

#### Was the change discussed in an issue or in the forum before?

- https://github.com/rclone/rclone/issues/3511
- https://forum.rclone.org/t/rclone-bisync-box-failed-to-create-file-system-is-a-directory-not-a-file/47908/19?u=nielash

#### Checklist

- [x] I have read the [contribution guidelines](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#submitting-a-new-feature-or-bug-fix).
- [x] I have added tests for all changes in this PR if appropriate.
- [x] I have added documentation for the changes if appropriate.
- [x] All commit messages are in [house style](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#commit-messages).
- [x] I'm done, this Pull Request is ready for review :-)

body: This is merged this to master now which means it will be in [the latest beta](https://beta.rclone.org/) in 15-30 minutes and released in v1.69 - thanks @nielash

issue.title: PikPak uploads fail in v1.70.1 with "aws-chunked encoding is not supported" error

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
#### The associated forum post URL from `https://forum.rclone.org`

(Not posted to forum yet)

#### What is the problem you are having with rclone?

After updating from rclone v1.69.2 to v1.70.1 on EndeavourOS (Arch Linux), uploads to PikPak stopped working. Every upload fails with an S3-related error about aws-chunked encoding not being supported with the specified x-amz-content-sha256 value. 

This appears to be a regression introduced in the new version as uploads were working fine with v1.69.2. To confirm this, I installed v1.69.2 on one of my servers, tried the same upload there and  it worked without any issues.

#### What is your rclone version

```
rclone v1.70.1
- os/version: endeavouros (64 bit)
- os/kernel: 6.15.3-arch1-1 (x86_64)
- os/type: linux
- os/arch: amd64
- go/version: go1.24.4
- go/linking: dynamic
- go/tags: none
```

#### Which OS you are using and how many bits (e.g. Windows 7, 64 bit)

EndeavourOS (Arch Linux), 64 bit

#### Which cloud storage system are you using? (e.g. Google Drive)

PikPak

#### The command you were trying to run (e.g. `rclone copy /tmp remote:tmp`)

```
rclone copy /home/username/Videos/test.mp4 pikpak:/test/ --stats-one-line -P -vv
```

#### A log from the command with the `-vv` flag 

```
rclone copy /home/username/Videos/test.mp4 pikpak:/test/ --stats-one-line -P -vv
2025/06/22 06:30:23 DEBUG : rclone: Version "v1.70.1" starting with parameters ["rclone" "copy" "/home/username/Videos/test.mp4" "pikpak:/test/" "--stats-one-line" "-P" "-vv"]
```
